Answer.157309: several factors come into play when considering whether it is wise or not to ride your horse bareback . your own riding skill level are you balanced correctly and can you remain balanced through any unexpected movements ? are you effective in your legs , hands , seat , and voice or do you get nervous easily and shut down ? are your muscles strong enough to remain engaged but not grip the horse for extended periods of time ? . is your horse used to the sensation of riding tackless ? have you ever tried it before ? the feeling of a rider with a saddle is different than the feeling of a rider without one and may be somewhat confusing for some horses the first time it s introduced . what is your horse s demeanor calm or prone to spooks ? will riding bareback be a safe option for you based on this and your ability to cope ? . what is the status of your horses back health ? are they well muscled and in shape , bony and elderly , or sway backed ? being able to support your weight over a strong and capable set of latissimus dorsi muscles is important . riding bareback is not as comfortable for either of you if your horse has a weak or bony back if you meet all these conditions , riding bareback is not harmful or unwise and can be quite fun and freeing for both horse and rider !
